meanings.definition: A rhetorical device in which a speaker breaks off from the flow of a speech to address a person or thing.
meanings.sent1: During the speech, the politician used an ecbole to directly speak to the audience.
meanings.sent2: The ecbole in the play added a dramatic pause for the actor to address the audience.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's ecbole to the microphone made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her ecbole to the mirror reflected her inner thoughts in a unique way.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's ecbole to the textbook made the lesson more engaging and interactive.

meanings.definition: The act of throwing or casting something.
meanings.sent1: With a swift ecbole, the baseball player threw the ball to the catcher.
meanings.sent2: The ecbole of the fishing line landed the bait perfectly in the water.
meanings.sent3: His ecbole of the paper airplane across the room surprised his classmates.
meanings.sent4: The ecbole of the dice determined the next player's turn in the game.
meanings.sent5: The ecbole of the stone into the pond created ripples in the water.
